alert.note: Alert for Central Highlands; Eastern San Miguel County; Espanola Valley; Santa Fe Metro Area; South Central Mountains; Upper Rio Grande Valley (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 03 at 10:27PM MST until January 05 at 6:00AM MST by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 5 AM THURSDAY TO 6 AM MST FRIDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations up to 5 inches. * WHERE...Central Highlands, South Central Mountains, Espanola Valley, Santa Fe Metro Area, Upper Rio Grande Valley, and Eastern San Miguel County. * WHEN...From 5 AM Thursday to 6 AM MST Friday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Tire traction will be reduced. Extend the distance between your vehicle and the vehicle in front of you. This includes along portions of I-25 near Santa Fe. The hazardous conditions could impact the Thursday morning and evening commutes.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. For the latest road conditions, dial 511 or 1.800.432.4269, or visit http://nmroads.com.

area.areaDesc: Central Highlands; Eastern San Miguel County; Espanola Valley; Santa Fe Metro Area; South Central Mountains; Upper Rio Grande Valley
